P.title: Will Pakistan recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if before 01-01-2030, reliable media sources report that the Pakistani government has recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan

Q_and_not_P.title: Will Turkey recognize AND Pakistan not recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: a.) At any point between September 1, 2021 to January 1, 2030, the Turkish government formally recognizes the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan AND b.) Before January 1, 2030, reliable media sources do not report that the Pakistani government has recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan. The question will resolve as NO otherwise.

P_or_Q.title: Will either Pakistan or Turkey recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030?
P_or_Q.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point before January 1, 2030, reliable media sources report that either the Pakistani government or the Turkish government has formally recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will Russia recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if before 01-01-2030, reliable media sources report that the Russian government has recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan

Q_and_not_P.title: Will Iran recognize AND Russia not recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: a.) At any time between January 1, 2021, and January 1, 2030, the Iranian government formally recognizes the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan, AND b.) Before January 1, 2030, reliable media sources do not report that the Russian government has recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan. The question will resolve as NO otherwise.

P_or_Q.title: Will either Russia or Iran recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030?
P_or_Q.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any time before January 1, 2030, reliable media sources report that either the Russian government or the Iranian government has formally recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will a space elevator successfully be built on Earth before 2100?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if a working space elevator is constructed on Earth before January 1, 2100 and is maintained in operation for at least 365 days

Q_and_not_P.title: Will humans have a sustainable off-world presence by 2100 AND a space elevator not be successfully built on Earth before 2100?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: a.) At any point before January 1, 2100, there is a settlement(s) off-Earth with over 2,000 5+ year residents that are self-sufficient in production of energy and foodstuffs, AND b.) A working space elevator is not constructed on Earth before January 1, 2100 or is not maintained in operation for at least 365 days.

P_or_Q.title: Will either a space elevator be successfully built on Earth before 2100 or humans have a sustainable off-world presence by 2100?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: 
(a) A working space elevator is constructed on Earth before January 1, 2100, and is maintained in operation for at least 365 days. 
(b) At any point before January 1, 2100, there is a settlement(s) off-Earth with over 2,000 5+ year residents that are self-sufficient in production of energy and foodstuffs.
Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will the average global CO₂ atmospheric concentration be less than 433.19 ppm over the 2024 to 2027 period?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if the arithmetic mean of the annual mean CO₂ concentration over the 2024 to 2027 period (inclusive) is less than or equal to 433.19 ppm, as reported by Earth System Research Laboratory.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will a Democrat win the 2024 US presidential election AND will the average global CO2 atmospheric concentration exceed 433.19 ppm over the 2024 to 2027 period?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: a.) A candidate from the Democratic Party receives the most votes in the Electoral College in the 2024 US Presidential Election, resolving on the date Congress certifies the votes, or when Congress selects the President in the case a candidate does not receive a majority. AND b.) The arithmetic mean of the annual mean CO2 concentration over the 2024 to 2027 period (inclusive) is more than 433.19 ppm, as reported by Earth System Research Laboratory.

P_or_Q.title: Will either the average global CO₂ atmospheric concentration be less than 433.19 ppm over the 2024 to 2027 period or a Democrat win the 2024 US presidential election?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if either of the following occurs: a.) The arithmetic mean of the annual mean CO₂ concentration over the 2024 to 2027 period (inclusive) is less than or equal to 433.19 ppm, as reported by Earth System Research Laboratory. OR b.) A candidate from the Democratic Party receives the most votes in the Electoral College in the 2024 US Presidential Election. It will resolve on the date Congress certifies the votes, or when Congress selects the President in the case a candidate does not receive a majority.

P.title: Will Biden be impeached by the US House of Representatives?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if the US House of Representatives votes to impeach the next President of the United States (meaning the president to take office after Donald Trump leaves office). This question will resolve as No if the next US president leaves office without being impeached

Q_and_not_P.title: Will a US Supreme Court Justice be impeached and removed before 2030 AND Biden not be impeached by the US House of Representatives?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur: a.) any US Supreme Court Justice is impeached and removed by the House and Senate before January 1, 2030, AND b.) the US House of Representatives does not vote to impeach Joe Biden, the president to take office after Donald Trump. The question will resolve as No if either a US Supreme Court Justice is not impeached and removed by the specified date, or if Joe Biden is impeached by the House before leaving office.

Fine Print
For part a.), an impeachment by just the House, overturned by the Senate, will not resolve the question positively. Nor will any vacancy by resignation, retirement, or death. For part b.), the impeachment must be a formal vote by the US House of Representatives.

P_or_Q.title: Will either the next US President after Donald Trump be impeached by the House of Representatives or a US Supreme Court Justice be impeached and removed before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) The US House of Representatives votes to impeach the next President of the United States (meaning the president to take office after Donald Trump leaves office). This question will resolve as No if the next US president leaves office without being impeached. (b) Any US Supreme Court Justice is impeached and removed by the House and Senate before January 1, 2030. Fine Print
An impeachment by just the House, overturned by the Senate, will not resolve the question positively. Nor will any vacancy by resignation, retirement, or death.

P.title: Will a legacy automaker go bankrupt before 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
If one of the top 10 current automakers (by vehicle sales), including Volkswagen, Toyota, Daimler/Mercedes, Ford, General Motors, Hyundai, Honda, SAIC, BMW, and Nissan, declares bankruptcy, the question resolves positively. Otherwise, it resolves negatively.
Fine Print
If the automaker declares bankruptcy the question will resolve positively even if they are bought out by another company or given a loan by the government

Q_and_not_P.title: Will the US set a new annual GDP growth rate record high before 2030 AND no legacy automaker go bankrupt before 2030?
Q_and_not_P.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: a.) In any year before Q1 2030, the US records a real GDP annual growth rate of greater than 8.7%, beating the record set in 1950, referring to Real GDP in terms of percent change from the preceding year as provided by the Bureau of Economic Analysis or other reputable sources of economic data. AND b.) None of the top 10 current automakers (by vehicle sales), including Volkswagen, Toyota, Daimler/Mercedes, Ford, General Motors, Hyundai, Honda, SAIC, BMW, and Nissan, declares bankruptcy before 2030. Resolves NO otherwise. The question will resolve positively even if an automaker is bought out by another company or given a loan by the government.

P_or_Q.title: Will either a legacy automaker go bankrupt before 2030 or the US set a new annual GDP growth rate record high before 2030?
P_or_Q.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) One of the top 10 current automakers (by vehicle sales), including Volkswagen, Toyota, Daimler/Mercedes, Ford, General Motors, Hyundai, Honda, SAIC, BMW, and Nissan, declares bankruptcy before 2030. This resolution applies even if the automaker is bought out by another company or given a loan by the government. (b) The US records a real GDP annual growth rate of greater than 8.7% in any year before Q1 2030, beating the record set in 1950. For the purpose of this question, Real GDP is in terms of percent change from the preceding year, as provided by the Bureau of Economic Analysis or other reputable sources of economic data. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will NASA land people on Mars prior to 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
The question will resolve positively even if the NASA-branded mission makes use of SpaceX transport system, under the condition that the main funding for the mission comes from USA budget

Q_and_not_P.title: Will Mars have a permanent population of 10,000 before the Moon does AND will NASA not land people on Mars prior to 2030?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for Mars vs. Moon population:
This question resolves YES if Mars has 10,000 people living on the body who have been residents for 3+ years at the time of counting before the Moon does, AND NASA does not land people on Mars prior to 2030. The residents must be on the planetary body itself, not on satellites or moons such as Phobos and Deimos. 'Residence' is defined by the government or entity administering the colony, or a similar official source, requiring a person to have lived there for at least a relatively uninterrupted three years. Ems do not count as humans. Resolves ambiguous if neither body meets the criterion by 2100.

Resolution Criteria for NASA landing on Mars:
The question will resolve positively if the NASA-branded mission does not make use of SpaceX transport system, or the main funding for the mission does not come from the USA budget.

The question resolves YES only if both criteria are met: Mars achieves a permanent population of 10,000 before the Moon, and NASA does not land people on Mars prior to 2030. Resolves NO if either Mars does not achieve a permanent population of 10,000 before the Moon, or NASA lands people on Mars prior to 2030, or if any other condition specified is not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will either NASA land people on Mars prior to 2030 or Mars have a permanent population of 10,000 before the Moon does?
P_or_Q.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) NASA lands people on Mars prior to 2030, even if the NASA-branded mission makes use of SpaceX transport system, provided that the main funding for the mission comes from the USA budget. (b) Mars has a permanent population of 10,000 before the Moon does. This includes considering factors such as distance, communication lag, gravity, rotation period, atmosphere, and solar energy. The population count must include people who have been residents for 3+ years at the time of counting, excluding residents of Phobos, Deimos, or satellites in orbit around either body. 'Residence' is defined by the government or entity administering the colony, or a similar official source. Resolves NO if neither of these conditions are met by 2100, or resolves ambiguous if neither body meets the criterion by 2100.

P.title: Will Stacey Abrams be elected president in or before the 2040 election?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This resolves positively if Stacey Abrams is elected president in or before 2040 and the result is not overturned prior to inauguration, whether or not she is actually inaugurated. This resolves negatively by any other outcome

Q_and_not_P.title: Will commercial animal farming be prohibited in the US and Stacey Abrams not be elected president in or before the 2040 election?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: a.) the US government passes legislation or the US constitution has been amended or interpreted by the Supreme Court to prohibit commercial animal farming before December 31, 2040, AND b.) Stacey Abrams is not elected president in or before the 2040 election or the result is overturned prior to inauguration, whether or not she is actually inaugurated. It will resolve as NO otherwise.

Fine Print
Commercial Animal farming is considered to be the branch of agriculture involving animals that are raised for the commerce of meat, fibre, milk, eggs, or other physical products. For example, dairy cows should count as animal farming, but not pet chickens or animals kept in zoos for entertainment purposes. Both aquaculture (fish-farming) and fishing for wild fish should also count for resolution of this question.

P_or_Q.title: Will either Stacey Abrams be elected president in or before the 2040 election, or will commercial animal farming be prohibited in the US before 2041?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Stacey Abrams is elected president in or before 2040 and the result is not overturned prior to inauguration, whether or not she is actually inaugurated. (b) The US government passes legislation or the US constitution has been amended or interpreted by the Supreme Court to prohibit commercial animal farming before December 31, 2040.

Fine Print
Commercial Animal farming is considered to be the branch of agriculture involving animals that are raised for the commerce of meat, fibre, milk, eggs, or other physical products. For example, dairy cows should count as animal farming, but not pet chickens or animals kept in zoos for entertainment purposes. Both aquaculture (fish-farming) and fishing for wild fish should also count for resolution of this question.
Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will the Insurrection Act be invoked before 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if the US federal government invokes the Insurrection Act at any time between January 1, 2022 to January 1, 2025. No additional criteria are necessary for this question to resolve positively.
Fine Print
If positive resolution is triggered, and it is later determined by a court or judge that the invocation was invalid or illegal, that will have no bearing on the resolution of this question.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will there be a "World War Three" before 2050 AND the Insurrection Act not be invoked before 2025?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:
a.) At any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, there is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, AND at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
b.) The US federal government does not invoke the Insurrection Act at any time between January 1, 2022 to January 1, 2025.

The question will resolve as NO if either of the above conditions is not met.

Fine Print
For condition a.), PPP may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence: IMF, World Bank, United Nations, CIA. If negative resolution is triggered for condition b.), and it is later determined by a court or judge that the invocation was valid or legal, that will have no bearing on the resolution of this question.

P_or_Q.title: Will either the Insurrection Act be invoked before 2025 or will there be a "World War Three" before 2050?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: 
(a) The US federal government invokes the Insurrection Act at any time between January 1, 2022 to January 1, 2025. A court or judge determining the invocation as invalid or illegal will not affect the resolution. 
(b) There is a military conflict before January 1, 2050, involving countries representing at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year of the conflict, and at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict. 
Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will there be active warfare between the United States and China before 2027?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves in the affirmative if, at some point between now and 31 December 2026, at least two credible news sources (e.g. the Australian Financial Review, the New York Times, the Washington Post, Reuters, Associated Press, etc.) report that the United States and China have exchanged fire, engaged in "kinetic conflict", fought a battle, fought a war or otherwise engaged in active warfare (and they are not talking metaphorically/about a "cold war")

Q_and_not_P.title: Will a US Democratic President sign into law a $500 billion spending cut before 2029 AND will there be no active warfare between the United States and China before 2027?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positive if both of the following occur: a.) before 2029, a Democratic US President signs into law a budget that provides for 500 billion dollars less in spending than the budget of the previous year, AND b.) at no point between now and 31 December 2026, do at least two credible news sources report that the United States and China have exchanged fire, engaged in "kinetic conflict", fought a battle, fought a war or otherwise engaged in active warfare (not metaphorically or in terms of a "cold war").

P_or_Q.title: Will there be active warfare between the United States and China before 2027 or will a US Democratic President sign into law a $500 billion spending cut before 2029?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria:
This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs:
1. At some point between now and 31 December 2026, at least two credible news sources (e.g., the Australian Financial Review, the New York Times, the Washington Post, Reuters, Associated Press, etc.) report that the United States and China have exchanged fire, engaged in "kinetic conflict", fought a battle, fought a war or otherwise engaged in active warfare (and they are not talking metaphorically/about a "cold war").
2. Before 2029, a Democratic US President signs into law a budget that provides for 500 billion dollars less in spending than the budget of the previous year.
Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will a new amendment to the US Constitution be ratified by 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
The US Constitution has been amended 27 times in its history, most recently in 1992. This question resolves positively if at least five reliable media outlets report that before January 1st 2050 the US constitution received a 28th amendment. Otherwise it resolves negatively.
This question will close and resolve 1 hour before any 28th amendment becomes law, if one does.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will the US Supreme Court change its membership size before 2050 AND no new amendment to the US Constitution be ratified by 2050?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: a.) The US Supreme Court officially changes its regular number of sitting justices above or below 9 members at any point between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2050. Expected vacancies and arrivals of justices (retirements, deaths, and absences for health reasons) are not sufficient to resolve the question as YES. AND b.) No reliable media outlets report that before January 1st 2050 the US constitution received a 28th amendment. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.
This question will close and resolve 1 hour before any 28th amendment becomes law, if one does.

P_or_Q.title: Will either a new amendment to the US Constitution be ratified or the US Supreme Court change its membership size before 2050?
P_or_Q.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs before January 1, 2050: (a) At least five reliable media outlets report that the US Constitution has received a 28th amendment. (b) The US Supreme Court officially changes its regular number of sitting justices above or below 9 members. Resolves NO otherwise. This question will close and resolve 1 hour before any 28th amendment becomes law, if one does.

P.title: Will FreeTON cryptocurrency project be successful?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if there will be at least 50 online shops that accept FreeTON on January 1, 2025, or if there will be publically available data from trusted online source showing that total amount of payments with FreeTON is more than $1M per month on January 1, 2025. Otherwise, the question will resolve negatively

Q_and_not_P.title: Will a Democrat win the 2024 US presidential election AND will the FreeTON cryptocurrency project not be successful?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: a.) A candidate from the Democratic Party receives the most votes in the Electoral College in the 2024 US Presidential Election, resolving on the date Congress certifies the votes, or when Congress selects the President in the case a candidate does not receive a majority. AND b.) There are not at least 50 online shops that accept FreeTON on January 1, 2025, and there is no publicly available data from a trusted online source showing that the total amount of payments with FreeTON is more than $1M per month on January 1, 2025. It will resolve as NO if either of these conditions is not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will either the FreeTON cryptocurrency project be successful or a Democrat win the 2024 US presidential election?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria:
This question will resolve positively if EITHER of the following occurs:
1. There are at least 50 online shops that accept FreeTON on January 1, 2025, OR there is publicly available data from a trusted online source showing that the total amount of payments with FreeTON is more than $1M per month on January 1, 2025.
2. A candidate from the Democratic Party receives the most votes in the Electoral College in the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution will occur on the date Congress certifies the votes, or when Congress selects the President in the case a candidate does not receive a majority.
Otherwise, the question will resolve negatively.

P.title: Will Biden be impeached by the US House of Representatives?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if the US House of Representatives votes to impeach the next President of the United States (meaning the president to take office after Donald Trump leaves office). This question will resolve as No if the next US president leaves office without being impeached

Q_and_not_P.title: In the 2024 US Presidential election, will any state submit results to the electoral college different from the projected winner AND will Biden not be impeached by the US House of Representatives?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for the combined question:

For the first part (a): This question resolves positively if any US state (including DC and districts of states) officially submits results to the electoral college by the Safe Harbor deadline (currently, December 10th, 2024) that are different from the projected winner of that state according to at least 6 of the following news desks: ABC, CBS, NBC, CNN, Fox, AP, Reuters, and the NYT.

For the second part (b): This question will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden leaves office without being impeached. This question will resolve as No if the US House of Representatives votes to impeach Joe Biden.

The combined question resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur, and NO otherwise.

P_or_Q.title: Will either the next US president after Donald Trump be impeached by the House of Representatives or any state submit different electoral results from the projected winner in the 2024 US Presidential election?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for Impeachment: This question will resolve as Yes if the US House of Representatives votes to impeach the next President of the United States (meaning the president to take office after Donald Trump leaves office). It will resolve as No if the next US president leaves office without being impeached.

Resolution Criteria for Electoral Results: This question resolves positively if any US state (including DC and districts of states) officially submits results to the electoral college by the Safe Harbor deadline (currently, December 10th, 2024) that are different from the projected winner of that state according to at least 6 of the following news desks: ABC, CBS, NBC, CNN, Fox, AP, Reuters, and the NYT.

The question resolves YES if either of the above conditions are met. It resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will PsiQuantum have a commercial quantum computer by 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively via PsiQuantum company report that they have a quantum computer for sale by 2025

Q_and_not_P.title: Will AI progress surprise us by predictions of AGI jumping sharply AND PsiQuantum not have a commercial quantum computer by 2025?
Q_and_not_P.body:
This question resolves YES if both of the following occur: 

a.) The Metaculus prediction odds and the community prediction odds of a positive resolution to Human Machine Intelligence Parity by 2040 at least triple within any two-month period before its close date. Examples of a tripling of the odds include 60% becoming at least 81.8%, 70% becoming at least 87.5%, 80% becoming at least 92.3%, 90% becoming at least 96.4%, etc. This change must occur in both Metaculus and community predictions. 

AND 

b.) PsiQuantum company does not report that they have a quantum computer for sale by 2025. 

The question resolves NO otherwise.

P_or_Q.title: Will either PsiQuantum have a commercial quantum computer by 2025 or will AI progress surprise us by predictions of AGI jumping sharply?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria:
1. PsiQuantum will have a commercial quantum computer by 2025: This question will resolve positively if PsiQuantum company reports that they have a quantum computer for sale by 2025.
2. AI progress surprises by predictions of AGI jumping sharply: This question resolves as YES if both the Metaculus prediction odds and the community prediction odds of a positive resolution to Human Machine Intelligence Parity by 2040 at least triple within any two-month period before its close date, and NO otherwise. Examples include odds of 60% becoming at least 81.8%, 70% becoming at least 87.5%, 80% becoming at least 92.3%, 90% becoming at least 96.4%, etc.

The question resolves YES if either of the above conditions are met, and NO otherwise.

P.title: Ragnarök Question Series: If a global catastrophe occurs, will it be due to an artificial intelligence failure-mode?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
The question resolves Yes if a catastrophe occurs resulting principally from the deployment of some artificial intelligence system(s) that claims at least 10% of the human population in any period of 5 years or less before 2100. It resolves No if this occurs for non-AI reasons, and Annulled if no global catastrophe occurs. Years are here defined as consecutive calendar years.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will the research group responsible for developing the first AGI be part of a university AND if a global catastrophe occurs, will it not be due to an AI failure-mode?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for the first part (AGI development): This question will resolve positively if the AI system that resolves the question 'Date first AGI is publicly known' was developed by a research group from a university. If the respective AI system is developed under a collaborative effort between two or more different institutions, the question resolves positively for both. For example, if OpenAI and UC Berkeley's CHAI had joined forces for the responsible project, this would count for both for-profit corporation and university.

Resolution Criteria for the second part (global catastrophe): The question resolves Yes if a catastrophe occurs resulting principally from non-AI reasons or if no catastrophe occurs, and Annulled if a catastrophe occurs resulting principally from the deployment of some artificial intelligence system(s) that claims at least 10% of the human population in any period of 5 years or less before 2100. Years are here defined as consecutive calendar years.

The combined question resolves YES only if both of the following conditions are met: (a) the first AGI is developed by a research group from a university (or in collaboration with other institutions where a university is a part of the collaborative effort), and (b) if a global catastrophe occurs, it is not due to an AI failure-mode, or no catastrophe occurs. The question resolves NO if either of these conditions is not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will either a global catastrophe be due to an AI failure-mode or the first AGI be developed by a university-affiliated research group?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria:
1. The question resolves YES if a global catastrophe occurs resulting principally from the deployment of some artificial intelligence system(s) that claims at least 10% of the human population in any period of 5 years or less before 2100. It resolves NO if this occurs for non-AI reasons, and Annulled if no global catastrophe occurs. Years are defined as consecutive calendar years.
2. The question also resolves YES if the AI system that resolves the question 'Date first AGI is publicly known' was developed by a research group from a university. If the respective AI system is developed under a collaborative effort between two or more different institutions, the question resolves positively for both. For example, if OpenAI and UC Berkeley's CHAI had joined forces for the responsible project, this would count for both for-profit corporation and university.

The question resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will the US propose a ban on hydrazine for spacecraft propulsion by January 20, 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any branch of the US federal government makes a formal proposal to ban Hydrazine and Hydrazine-derivative spacecraft fuels before January 20, 2025. It is not necessary for this proposal to recieve a vote or become law to resolve this question

Q_and_not_P.title: Will Republicans win control of the US House of Representatives in 2024 AND the US not propose a ban on hydrazine for spacecraft propulsion by January 20, 2025?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for the US House of Representatives in 2024:
Resolves YES if Republicans win 50% + 1 or more seats in the US House. Resolves NO if Democrats win 50% + 1 or more seats. If neither of those parties wins 50% + 1 or more (e.g., an unaligned 3rd party wins seats), then the question resolves ambiguously. Independents who caucus with the Republicans will be counted as Republicans; likewise, independents who caucus with Democrats.

Resolution Criteria for the ban on hydrazine:
This question will also resolve as YES if no branch of the US federal government makes a formal proposal to ban Hydrazine and Hydrazine-derivative spacecraft fuels before January 20, 2025.

The combined question will resolve YES only if both conditions are met: Republicans win control of the US House of Representatives in 2024 AND there is no formal proposal to ban hydrazine for spacecraft propulsion by January 20, 2025. It will resolve NO if either condition is not met. If the question regarding the US House of Representatives resolves ambiguously, the combined question will also resolve ambiguously.

P_or_Q.title: Will either the US propose a ban on hydrazine for spacecraft propulsion by January 20, 2025, or will Republicans win control of the US House of Representatives in 2024?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria:
This question will resolve as YES if any of the following occur:
1. Any branch of the US federal government makes a formal proposal to ban Hydrazine and Hydrazine-derivative spacecraft fuels before January 20, 2025. It is not necessary for this proposal to receive a vote or become law to resolve this question.
2. Republicans win 50% + 1 or more seats in the US House of Representatives in the 2024 elections. If Democrats win 50% + 1 or more seats, or if neither of those parties wins 50% + 1 or more (e.g., an unaligned 3rd party wins seats), then the question resolves NO for this part. Independents who caucus with the Republicans will be counted as Republicans; likewise, independents who caucus with Democrats will be counted as Democrats.

The question will resolve as NO if neither of the above conditions are met.

P.title: Ragnarök Question Series: if an artificial intelligence catastrophe occurs, will it reduce the human population by 95% or more?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
In the first part of the Ragnarök Question Series, we asked the question If a global catastrophe occurs, will it be due to an artificial intelligence failure-mode? Now it is asked,
Given that an artificial intelligence failure-mode catastrophe occurs that results in the reduction of global population of at least 10% by 2100, will the global population decline by more than 95% relative to the pre-catastrophe population?
The question resolves positive if such a catastrophe does occur, and the global population is less than 5% of the pre-catastrophe population at any point within 25 years of the catastrophe. It resolves ambiguous if an artificial intelligence global catastrophe that claims at least 10% (in any period of 5 years or less) does not occur. The question resolves negative if a an artificial intelligence failure-mode induced global catastrophe occurs that claims at least 10% (in any period of 5 years or less) but the post-catastrophe population remains above 5%.

Q_and_not_P.title: By 2100, will the human population decrease by at least 10% during any period of 5 years AND if an artificial intelligence catastrophe occurs, will it not reduce the human population by 95% or more?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for combined question:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:
a.) The human population (on Earth, and possibly elsewhere) decreases by at least 10% in any period of 5 consecutive calendar years by 2100.
b.) Given that an artificial intelligence failure-mode catastrophe occurs that results in the reduction of the global population of at least 10% by 2100, the global population is more than 5% of the pre-catastrophe population at any point within 25 years of the catastrophe.
The question will resolve as NO if either of the above conditions is not met. It resolves ambiguous if an artificial intelligence global catastrophe that claims at least 10% (in any period of 5 years or less) does not occur by 2100. The question resolves negative if an artificial intelligence failure-mode induced global catastrophe occurs that claims at least 10% (in any period of 5 years or less) but the post-catastrophe population remains at or below 5% of the pre-catastrophe population.

P_or_Q.title: Will either an AI catastrophe reduce the human population by 95% or more, or will the human population decrease by at least 10% during any 5-year period by 2100?
P_or_Q.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Given that an artificial intelligence failure-mode catastrophe occurs that results in the reduction of global population of at least 10% by 2100, the global population declines by more than 95% relative to the pre-catastrophe population at any point within 25 years of the catastrophe. (b) The human population (on Earth, and possibly elsewhere) decreases by at least 10% in any period of 5 years or less by 2100. Resolves NO if neither of these conditions are met. The question resolves ambiguous if an artificial intelligence global catastrophe that claims at least 10% (in any period of 5 years or less) does not occur.

P.title: Will humans go extinct before 2100?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if there are no known humans alive on January 1, 2100. For these purposes we'll define humans as biological creatures who have as their ancestors – via a chain of live births from mothers – circa 2000 humans OR who could mate with circa 2000 humans to produce viable offspring. (So AIs, ems, genetically engineered beings of a different species brought up in artificial wombs, etc. would not count). Any living humans living anywhere in the observable universe (or multiverse) (who are known to the entities operating Metaculus) on that date will be sufficient to resolve the question negatively.
N.B. Even though it is obviously the case that if human extinction occurs Metaculus points won't be very valuable anymore and that it will be practically impossible to check for true human extinction (zero humans left), I would like to ask people not to let this fact influence their prediction and to predict in good faith

Q_and_not_P.title: Will there be more than 13 people off of planet Earth on December 31, 2050, AND will humans not go extinct before 2100?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolves YES if both of the following occur: a.) The population of humans off of planet Earth at midnight UTC time of December 31, 2050, is higher than 13, where 'off of planet Earth' means farther than 100km from the surface of Earth, using the altitude conventionally used for space records. AND b.) There are known humans alive on January 1, 2100, defined as biological creatures who have as their ancestors 
– via a chain of live births from mothers – circa 2000 humans OR who could mate with circa 2000 humans to produce viable offspring, living anywhere in the observable universe (or multiverse) and known to the entities operating Metaculus. Resolves NO otherwise.

P_or_Q.title: Will either humans go extinct before 2100 or will there be more than 13 people off of planet Earth on December 31, 2050?
P_or_Q.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There are no known humans alive on January 1, 2100, where humans are defined as biological creatures who have as their ancestors – via a chain of live births from mothers – circa 2000 humans, or who could mate with circa 2000 humans to produce viable offspring. Any living humans anywhere in the observable universe (or multiverse) known to the entities operating Metaculus on that date will be sufficient to resolve the question negatively. (b) The population of humans off of planet Earth at midnight UTC time of December 31, 2050, is higher than 13, where 'off of planet Earth' means farther than 100km from the surface of Earth, using the altitude conventionally used for space records. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will there be a city on Earth with a population of over 100 million by 2100?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
For a mostly hairless, fangless species that was likely reduced to just a few thousand members in relatively recent times by a volcano, we've certainly been busy.
The human population on Earth now exceeds 7 billion. And we're still growing. Not everyone is thrilled by this. But it's reality.
Currently, as of Q2 2018, Tokyo, Japan is the world's largest metropolis, cramming over 38,000,000 people (give or take) into its borders.
But by the end of the century, we could (and probably will) witness far grander cities.
Per Canadian demographers, Daniel Hoornweg and Kevin Pope, for instance, Lagos in Nigeria may swell to 100+M by 2100 if trends continue. Face 2 Face Africa has the story:
By 2100 if Nigeria’s population continues to grow and people move to cities at the same rate as now, Lagos with its current 20 million people could be home to more people than the state of California.
The demographers' full paper is here.
The International Institute for Environment and Development goes into detail about why Hoornweg and Pope are so bullish on Africa here.
Whether it's Lagos that claims the crown or some other city in Africa or elsewhere, what do you think? Will some metro hit 100M people by 2100? (For the estimate we will include the general metropolitan area rather than the strict city boundaries, as done here)

Q_and_not_P.title: Will Nigeria's population exceed 400 million before 2050 AND will there not be a city on Earth with a population of over 100 million by 2100?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:
a.) The total population of Nigeria is at least 400 million people at any point before January 1, 2050, according to the United Nations, World Health Organisation, competent statistical authorities in Nigeria, or similarly credible data. The data need not be available on January 1, 2050; but it must provide population figures for that date or earlier.
b.) There is no city on Earth with a population of over 100 million by 2100, including the general metropolitan area rather than the strict city boundaries.

Fine Print
If in January 2050 Nigeria is no longer an independent country, the first part of the question will resolve as Ambiguous. The second part of the question does not have any specific fine print conditions mentioned. The question will resolve as NO if either one of the conditions is not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will there be a city on Earth with a population of over 100 million by 2100 or will Nigeria's population exceed 400 million before 2050?
P_or_Q.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: a.) There is a city on Earth with a population of over 100 million by 2100, considering the general metropolitan area rather than strict city boundaries. b.) Nigeria's population exceeds 400 million at any point before January 1, 2050, according to the United Nations, World Health Organisation, competent statistical authorities in Nigeria, or similarly credible data. The data need not be available on January 1, 2050, but it must provide population figures for that date or earlier. Resolves NO otherwise. If in January 2050 Nigeria is no longer an independent country, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P.title: Will the research group that is responsible for developing the first AGI be part of a for-profit corporation?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if the AI system that resolves the question Date first AGI is publicly known. was developed by a research group from a for-profit corporation.
If the respective AI system is developed under a collaborative effort between two or more different institutions, the question resolves positively for both. For example, if OpenAI and UC Berkeley's CHAI had joined forces for the responsible project, this would count for both for-profit corporation and university.
Sister questions
Nationalized organization develops first AGI
Non-profit organization develops first AGI
Government project develops first AGI
[University group develops first AGI](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/8326/univ…

Q_and_not_P.title: Will a S&P500 tech boom surpass the dotcom bubble for one quarter or more before 2025 AND will the research group responsible for developing the first AGI not be part of a for-profit corporation?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for P: This question will resolve as Yes if the average sector weighting of the IT industry of the S&P500 surpasses 30% for either a three consecutive month period or a 90 consecutive days period, before the end of 2024. For the purpose of this question, we shall refer to the current weightings of the SPDR S&P 500 ETF.

Resolution Criteria for Q: This question will resolve positively if the AI system that resolves the question 'Date first AGI is publicly known.' was not developed by a research group from a for-profit corporation. If the respective AI system is developed under a collaborative effort between two or more different institutions, the question resolves positively for both. For example, if OpenAI and UC Berkeley's CHAI had joined forces for the responsible project, this would count for both for-profit corporation and university.

The combined question will resolve YES only if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The average sector weighting of the IT industry of the S&P500 surpasses 30% for either a three consecutive month period or a 90 consecutive days period, before the end of 2024, AND (2) The research group responsible for developing the first AGI is not part of a for-profit corporation. The question will resolve NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will either the research group that develops the first AGI be part of a for-profit corporation or will a S&P500 tech boom surpass the dotcom bubble for one quarter or more before 2025?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for AGI development: This question will resolve positively if the AI system that resolves the question 'Date first AGI is publicly known' was developed by a research group from a for-profit corporation. If the respective AI system is developed under a collaborative effort between two or more different institutions, the question resolves positively for both. For example, if OpenAI and UC Berkeley's CHAI had joined forces for the responsible project, this would count for both for-profit corporation and university.

Resolution Criteria for S&P500 tech boom: This question will resolve as Yes if the average sector weighting of the IT industry of the S&P500 surpasses 30% for either a three consecutive month period or a 90 consecutive days period, before the end of 2024. For the purpose of this question, we shall refer to the current weightings of the SPDR S&P 500 ETF.

P.title: Will Elon Musk personally set foot on the moon by 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if before 1 January 2030, Elon Musk has personally set foot on the lunar surface. Musk must stand on the surface of the moon, outside any landing system that delivered him there.
This question resolves negatively if Musk does not stand on the moon's surface before 1 January 2030.
Fine Print
UTC time shall be used for this question. Musk need not travel on any SpaceX system for a positive resolution; any outcome in which Musk stands on the lunar surface before 1 January 2030 triggers positive resolution.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will Tesla become the largest car company by sales before 2035 AND will Elon Musk not personally set foot on the moon by 2030?
Q_and_not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: a.) Tesla Motors becomes the largest car producer in the world at any point before January 1, 2035, according to global car sales data from the International Organization of Motor Vehicle Manufacturers (OICA), or an alternative credible source of data if OICA data is not available, AND b.) Elon Musk has not personally set foot on the lunar surface before January 1, 2030. The question will resolve as NO if either Tesla does not become the largest car producer by the specified date or if Elon Musk does set foot on the moon's surface before the specified date. UTC time shall be used for both parts of this question.

P_or_Q.title: Will either Elon Musk personally set foot on the moon by 2030 or Tesla become the largest car company in the world by sales before 2035?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if any of the following occur: a.) Elon Musk has personally set foot on the lunar surface before 1 January 2030. Musk must stand on the surface of the moon, outside any landing system that delivered him there, using UTC time for timing. Musk need not travel on any SpaceX system for a positive resolution; any outcome in which Musk stands on the lunar surface before 1 January 2030 triggers positive resolution. b.) Tesla Motors is the largest car producer in the world at any point before January 1, 2035, according to global car sales data from the International Organization of Motor Vehicle Manufacturers (OICA). If data from OICA is not available during this period, Metaculus may select an alternative credible source of data, or resolve as Ambiguous at their discretion.
This question resolves negatively if neither of these conditions are met.

P.title: Will a book written by a language model make the NY Times Best Seller list before 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
A book is said to have been written by a language model if a language model wrote at least 99% of the text contained in the main section in the book, excluding a potential foreword, copyright notice, table of contents, and other non-essential book sections. The main text must also contain at least 20,000 words. Stylistic edits by humans are allowed if they do not change the basic semantic meaning of any sentence, or they merely correct basic spelling, grammatical, or formatting mistakes. Admins will use their discretion, in consultation with the community, to determine whether any candidate book meets the spirit of these conditions.
This question resolves positively if the above conditions are met before 2030, and negatively otherwise

Q_and_not_P.title: Before 2030, will an AI complete the Turing Test in the Kurzweil/Kapor Longbet AND no book written by a language model make the NY Times Best Seller list?
Q_and_not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 

a.) The Long Now Foundation declares Ray Kurzweil the winner of the Turing Test bet, indicating that an AI has completed the Turing Test as per the criteria set by the bet, which includes a series of Turing Test Trials with interviews and voting by appointed judges. 

AND 

b.) No book written by a language model, where the language model wrote at least 99% of the text contained in the main section of the book (excluding non-essential sections) with the main text containing at least 20,000 words, makes the NY Times Best Seller list before 2030. Stylistic edits by humans are allowed if they do not change the basic semantic meaning of any sentence, or they merely correct basic spelling, grammatical, or formatting mistakes. 

The question will resolve as NO if either Ray Kurzweil is not declared the winner of the Turing Test bet by the Long Now Foundation or a book written by a language model makes the NY Times Best Seller list before 2030.

P_or_Q.title: Will either a book written by a language model make the NY Times Best Seller list before 2030, or an AI complete the Turing Test in the Kurzweil/Kapor Longbet before 2030?
P_or_Q.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs before 2030: (a) A book is written by a language model and makes the NY Times Best Seller list. A book is considered written by a language model if a language model wrote at least 99% of the text contained in the main section of the book, excluding non-essential sections like the foreword and copyright notice, with the main text containing at least 20,000 words. Stylistic edits by humans are allowed if they do not change the basic semantic meaning of any sentence or merely correct basic spelling, grammatical, or formatting mistakes. (b) An AI completes the Turing Test in the Kurzweil/Kapor Longbet, which will be determined if the Long Now Foundation declares Ray Kurzweil the winner of this bet. The Turing Test involves multiple sessions and trials, with each session consisting of online text message interviews conducted by appointed judges with both the AI and human foils. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Ragnarök Question Series: If a global catastrophe occurs, will it be due to nuclear war?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
In the headline question to this series, I defined a global catastrophe as a 10% decrease in the world population in any period of 5 years.
If a global catastrophe happens before 2100, will it be principally due to the deployment of nuclear weapons?
The question resolves positively if a global nuclear catastrophe occurs that claims at least 10% in any period of 5 years or less before 2100, and resolves as ambiguous if no such global catastrophe happens. Years are here defined as consecutive calendar years.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050 AND if a global catastrophe occurs before 2100, will it not be due to nuclear war?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for the combined question:

This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. At any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
- There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
- There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.

AND

2. A global catastrophe occurs that claims at least 10% of the world population in any period of 5 years or less before 2100 and is not principally due to nuclear weapons.

The question resolves as NO if either one of the conditions is not met.

In the context of this question, an armed conflict will be defined as a dispute that concerns a government and/or territory where the use of armed force between two parties, of which at least one is the government of a state, results in an exchange of weapon fire or detonations.

A global catastrophe is defined as a 10% decrease in the world population in any period of 5 years. Years are here defined as consecutive calendar years.
The question resolves as ambiguous if no such global catastrophe happens.

P_or_Q.title: Will either a global catastrophe due to nuclear war occur before 2100, or will armed conflicts between the United States and China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
P_or_Q.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occur: (a) A global catastrophe, defined as a 10% decrease in the world population in any period of 5 years, happens before 2100 and is principally due to the deployment of nuclear weapons. This catastrophe must claim at least 10% of the world population in any period of 5 years or less before 2100. (b) At any time between January 1, 2021, and January 1, 2050, there are at least three credible government sources or three credible news reports of at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths. These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: If human-level artificial intelligence is developed, will World GDP grow by at least 30.0% in any of the subsequent 15 years?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
If a machine passes the test in this Metaculus question, this question resolves as YES if world GDP grows by at least 30.0% for any single year in the fifteen years following the date of the test, according to a reputable organization such as The World Bank, and NO if it doesn't.
If no machine passes that test by 2100-01-01, then this question resolves ambiguously.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will a nuclear weapon be detonated as an act of war by 2050 AND if human-level AI is developed, will World GDP not grow by at least 30.0% in any of the subsequent 15 years?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for P: This question will resolve as Yes if there is any nuclear detonation as an act of war between January 1, 2020 and January 1, 2050. Resolution will be by credible media reports. The detonation must be deliberate; accidental, inadvertent, or testing/peaceful detonations will not qualify. Attacks using strategic and tactical nuclear weapons are both sufficient to qualify.

Resolution Criteria for Q: If a machine passes the test in the referenced Metaculus question, this question resolves as YES if world GDP does not grow by at least 30.0% for any single year in the fifteen years following the date of the test, according to a reputable organization such as The World Bank, and NO if it does. If no machine passes that test by 2100-01-01, then this question resolves ambiguously.

The combined question resolves YES only if both of the following occur: (a) There is a deliberate nuclear detonation as an act of war between January 1, 2020 and January 1, 2050, AND (b) following the development of human-level AI, as determined by the referenced Metaculus question, World GDP does not grow by at least 30.0% in any of the subsequent 15 years. If either (a) does not occur, or (b) does not occur, or if (b) cannot be evaluated due to the non-development of human-level AI by 2100-01-01, then the combined question resolves NO.

P_or_Q.title: Will either human-level artificial intelligence lead to a 30.0% growth in World GDP in any of the subsequent 15 years, or will a nuclear weapon be detonated as an act of war by 2050?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria:
1. If a machine passes the test in the specified Metaculus question, this question resolves as YES if world GDP grows by at least 30.0% for any single year in the fifteen years following the date of the test, according to a reputable organization such as The World Bank, and NO if it doesn't. If no machine passes that test by 2100-01-01, then this question resolves ambiguously.
2. This question will also resolve as YES if there is any nuclear detonation as an act of war between January 1, 2020 and January 1, 2050, according to credible media reports. The detonation must be deliberate; accidental, inadvertent, or testing/peaceful detonations will not qualify. Attacks using strategic and tactical nuclear weapons are both sufficient to qualify.
This question resolves NO if neither of the above conditions are met.

P.title: Will the total yield across all countries' nuclear stockpiles at the end of 2029 exceed 10,000Mt?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
Resolution will be based on the most recent estimates published in 2029 by reputable sources such as the Federation of American Scientists (FAS). If no reputable sources explicitly estimate the total yield across all states' nuclear stockpiles in 2029, resolution will be left up to Metaculus admins, who will:
ask an author of relevant publications (e.g., Matt Korda) for an estimate, and/or
make an estimate based on what reputable sources say about things like the number of weapons of various types and the yield of those weapons, or the numbers and median yields of each states' nuclear stockpile
Fine Print
One example of a scenario where this question would resolve positively is one in which stockpiles include a total of more than 20,000 warheads and their mean yield is 500kt.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will the New START nuclear arms control agreement be renewed until at least February 5, 2027, AND will the total yield across all countries' nuclear stockpiles at the end of 2029 not exceed 10,000Mt?
Q_and_not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions occur:

For the New START nuclear arms control agreement:
- There are credible reports such as by the Arms Control Association of New START being extended to at least February 5, 2027.
- OR there are credible reports of New START being replaced by another nuclear arms control agreement that will last until at least February 5, 2027 and that US officials, Russian officials, and other credible sources describe as a successor to New START. It is not necessary that the renewed or replacement treaty has very similar terms. However, the second condition would not be met if one or two of the three relevant groups (US officials, Russian officials, or other credible sources) do not describe the treaty as a successor to New START.

For the total yield across all countries' nuclear stockpiles at the end of 2029:
- Resolution will be based on the most recent estimates published in 2029 by reputable sources such as the Federation of American Scientists (FAS).
- If no reputable sources explicitly estimate the total yield across all states' nuclear stockpiles in 2029, resolution will be left up to Metaculus admins, who will ask an author of relevant publications (e.g., Matt Korda) for an estimate, and/or make an estimate based on what reputable sources say about things like the number of weapons of various types and the yield of those weapons, or the numbers and median yields of each states' nuclear stockpile.

One example of a scenario where this question would resolve positively is one in which stockpiles include a total of less than or equal to 20,000 warheads and their mean yield is 500kt or less.

The question resolves NO if either of the conditions is not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will either the total yield across all countries' nuclear stockpiles at the end of 2029 exceed 10,000Mt or the New START nuclear arms control agreement be renewed until at least February 5, 2027?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if either of the following conditions occur:
1. The total yield across all countries' nuclear stockpiles at the end of 2029 exceeds 10,000Mt, based on the most recent estimates published in 2029 by reputable sources such as the Federation of American Scientists (FAS). If no reputable sources explicitly estimate the total yield, resolution will be left up to Metaculus admins, who will ask an author of relevant publications (e.g., Matt Korda) for an estimate, or make an estimate based on what reputable sources say about the number of weapons of various types and their yields, or the numbers and median yields of each state's nuclear stockpile.
2. The New START nuclear arms control agreement is either extended to at least February 5, 2027, or replaced by another nuclear arms control agreement that lasts until at least February 5, 2027 and is described by US officials, Russian officials, and other credible sources as a successor to New START.
Fine Print
For the nuclear stockpiles, an example of a scenario where this question would resolve positively is one in which stockpiles include a total of more than 20,000 warheads and their mean yield is 500kt.
For the New START agreement, it is not necessary that the renewed or replacement treaty has very similar terms. However, the second condition would not be met if one or two of the three relevant groups (US officials, Russian officials, or other credible sources) do not describe the treaty as a successor to New START.

P.title: If human-level artificial intelligence is developed, will World GDP grow by at least 30.0% in any of the subsequent 15 years?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
If a machine passes the test in this Metaculus question, this question resolves as YES if world GDP grows by at least 30.0% for any single year in the fifteen years following the date of the test, according to a reputable organization such as The World Bank, and NO if it doesn't.
If no machine passes that test by 2100-01-01, then this question resolves ambiguously.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will there be a "World War Three" before 2050 AND if human-level artificial intelligence is developed, will World GDP not grow by at least 30.0% in any of the subsequent 15 years?
Q_and_not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:
a.) At any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, there is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing, AND at least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict.
b.) If a machine passes the test in the Metaculus question referred to in the original question Q, then world GDP does not grow by at least 30.0% for any single year in the fifteen years following the date of the test, according to a reputable organization such as The World Bank.

The question will resolve as NO if either of the above conditions is not met. If no machine passes the test for human-level artificial intelligence by 2100-01-01, then the second part of the question resolves ambiguously, which may affect the resolution of the combined question.

PPP for condition a.) may be determined from the following sources, in order of precedence: IMF, World Bank, United Nations, CIA.

P_or_Q.title: Will either human-level artificial intelligence be developed and lead to at least 30.0% growth in World GDP in any of the subsequent 15 years, or will there be a "World War Three" before 2050?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for each event:
1. If a machine passes the test in the Metaculus question, this question resolves as YES if world GDP grows by at least 30.0% for any single year in the fifteen years following the date of the test, according to a reputable organization such as The World Bank, and NO if it doesn't. If no machine passes that test by 2100-01-01, then this question resolves ambiguously.
2. This question will resolve as YES if, at any time between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2050, both of these conditions are true: a) There is a military conflict involving countries representing in totality at least 30% of world GDP in PPP or 50% of world population in any year in which the conflict is ongoing. b) At least 10 million people (civilians or military personnel) have been killed in the conflict. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will there be a commercial service to travel between London and New York City in under three hours before 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if at least one living human makes the journey from inside the metropolitan area of New York City, United States to Greater London, United Kingdom (or vice-versa) in under three hours any point before January 1, 2030 by commercially available means, including chartered privately owned or operated civil aircraft or spacecraft, but not military aircraft or spacecraft.
The measured time will include only the journey itself (i.e. excluding time spent checking in, going through a security process, waiting on the tarmac at an airport before takeoff, et cetera.)

Q_and_not_P.title: Will humanity maintain a continuous off-Earth presence until 2050 AND there not be a commercial service to travel between London and New York City in under three hours before 2030?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for both:

For the continuous off-Earth presence until 2050:
- At least one living and conscious biological human must be physically located beyond 100km altitude above Earth's mean sea level at all times continuously until 1 January 2050.
- If the number of living and conscious biological humans off-Earth drops to zero at any time before 1 January 2050, this part resolves negatively.
- EMs, AI systems, humans in suspended animation or cryopreservation, and all other instances of either wholly non-biological or non-conscious humans do not count.
- Biological humans with cybernetic augmentation will count, provided they could reproduce with un-augmented humans.

For the commercial service to travel between London and NYC in under three hours before 2030:
- No living human must make the journey from inside the metropolitan area of New York City, United States to Greater London, United Kingdom (or vice-versa) in under three hours by commercially available means before January 1, 2030.
- The measured time includes only the journey itself, excluding time spent checking in, security processes, waiting on the tarmac, etc.

The question resolves YES if both criteria are met. It resolves NO if either or both do not occur.

P_or_Q.title: Will there be a commercial service to travel between London and New York City in under three hours before 2030 or will humanity maintain a continuous off-Earth presence until 2050?
P_or_Q.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: a.) At least one living human makes the journey from inside the metropolitan area of New York City, United States to Greater London, United Kingdom (or vice-versa) in under three hours any point before January 1, 2030 by commercially available means, including chartered privately owned or operated civil aircraft or spacecraft, but not military aircraft or spacecraft. The measured time will include only the journey itself (excluding time spent checking in, going through a security process, waiting on the tarmac at an airport before takeoff, etc.). OR b.) At least one living and conscious biological human must be physically located at some point beyond 100km altitude above Earth's mean sea level at all times continuously until 1 January 2050. This could include persons aboard spacecraft and space stations, as well as persons on any astronomical object other than Earth (e.g., Moon or Mars explorers/settlers). If the number of living and conscious biological humans off-Earth drops to zero at any time before 1 January 2050, this question resolves negatively. EMs, artificial intelligence systems, humans in suspended animation or cryopreservation, and all other instances of either wholly non-biological or non-conscious humans will not count for the purposes of this question. Humans who are merely sleeping will be considered conscious for the purposes of this question. However, biological humans with some degree of cybernetic augmentation (brain implants, artificial limbs or organs, etc) will suffice, so long as they could still reproduce with un-augmented humans. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will the number of deaths from antibiotic-resistant infections per year double by December 31, 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
In 1928, biologist Alexander Fleming discovered - by accident - that where the Penicillium mould had grown on a petri dish the bacteria nearby had been killed. This was due to a chemical the mould secreted, which he named "penicillin" - the antibiotic we know and love today.
Since the discovery of penicillin, antibiotics have saved hundreds of millions of lives and become an essential part of modern medicine.
But they're getting less effective. Repeated use has led to the existence of resistant strains of bacteria, which are immune to the effects of multiple different antibiotics. This has been described as a "serious, worldwide threat to public health" by the WHO.
In 2013 the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) reported that over 23,000 people died each year from antibiotic-resistant infections in the US. More recent data on their website suggests the figure is more like 37,000.
At any point before the end of the calendar year 2025, will the CDC or another credible source report that at least 70,000 people die annually from antibiotic-resistant infections in the US?

Q_and_not_P.title: Will there be a 50% decline in global meat production by 2040 AND will the number of deaths from antibiotic-resistant infections per year not double by December 31, 2025?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for P: This resolves positively if global meat production as per OurWorldInData is below 50% of its 2018 level (i.e., is 171.21 million tons or lower) in any year between 2019 and 2040 (inclusive). If OurWorldInData ceases publishing this data by this date, admins can choose a credible alternative source for resolution. Cultivated meat, which is produced from in vitro cell culture of animal cells rather than from the slaughter of livestock, does not count toward the overall global meat production figure. Only meat coming from slaughtered animals will count, as is currently the case with Our World's in Data figure of 340M tons as of 2018. Since this 340M tons figure does not include fish/seafood, data from FAOSTAT as tracked by OWID 
Resolution Criteria for Q: At any point before the end of the calendar year 2025, will the CDC or another credible source not report that at least 70,000 people die annually from antibiotic-resistant infections in the US?

The question resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) Global meat production is below 50% of its 2018 level (171.21 million tons or lower) in any year between 2019 and 2040, excluding cultivated meat and fish/seafood, and (b) The number of deaths from antibiotic-resistant infections per year in the US does not double to at least 70,000 by December 31, 2025, according to the CDC or another credible source. The question resolves NO otherwise.

P_or_Q.title: Will either the number of deaths from antibiotic-resistant infections per year double by December 31, 2025, or will there be a 50% decline in global meat production by 2040?
P_or_Q.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) At any point before the end of the calendar year 2025, the CDC or another credible source reports that at least 70,000 people die annually from antibiotic-resistant infections in the US. This would indicate that the number of deaths has doubled from earlier figures around 37,000. (b) Global meat production as per OurWorldInData is below 50% of its 2018 level (i.e., is 171.21 million tons or lower) in any year between 2019 and 2040 (inclusive). Cultivated meat and seafood do not count towards this figure. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will the first AGI be based on deep learning?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
Assume for the purpose of this question, that this question resolves on some date.
Metaculus admin(s) and/or community moderator(s) will survey 11 AI researchers whose work they consider relevant and whose work has been cited at least 500 times within the past 365 days according to Google Scholar. We will then ask about the relevant AI system:
Was the relevant AI system based on Deep Learning, as defined by the 2016 version of the Deep Learning Book?
Respondents will be requested to submit only one of the following responses:
The complete system was based on DL
Most of system was based on DL
At least a significant portion of the system was based on DL
Only a minor portion of the system was based on DL
No portion, or only a trivial portion of the system was based on DL
I don't know
Then the question resolves positively if a majority of surveyed experts who don't respond "I don't know" respond as follows:
The complete system was based on DL
Most of system was based on DL
The question resolves ambiguously if a majority of experts respond "I don't know".

Q_and_not_P.title: Will the research group responsible for developing the first AGI be part of a for-profit corporation AND will the first AGI not be based on deep learning?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for the combined question:

This question will resolve positively if BOTH of the following conditions are met:

1. The AI system that resolves the question 'Date first AGI is publicly known.' was developed by a research group from a for-profit corporation. If the respective AI system is developed under a collaborative effort between two or more different institutions, the question resolves positively for both. For example, if OpenAI and UC Berkeley's CHAI had joined forces for the responsible project, this would count for both for-profit corporation and university.

AND

2. Metaculus admin(s) and/or community moderator(s) will survey 11 AI researchers whose work they consider relevant and whose work has been cited at least 500 times within the past 365 days according to Google Scholar, asking about the relevant AI system: 'Was the relevant AI system based on Deep Learning, as defined by the 2016 version of the Deep Learning Book?' The question resolves positively if a majority of surveyed experts who don't respond 'I don't know' respond that 'Only a minor portion of the system was based on DL' or 'No portion, or only a trivial portion of the system was based on DL'. The question resolves ambiguously if a majority of experts respond 'I don't know'.

The question resolves negatively if EITHER of the above conditions is not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will either the first AGI be based on deep learning or the research group responsible for developing the first AGI be part of a for-profit corporation?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for each part:

(a) For the first AGI being based on deep learning:
Metaculus admin(s) and/or community moderator(s) will survey 11 AI researchers whose work they consider relevant and whose work has been cited at least 500 times within the past 365 days according to Google Scholar. They will ask if the relevant AI system was based on Deep Learning, as defined by the 2016 version of the Deep Learning Book. The question resolves positively if a majority of surveyed experts who don't respond "I don't know" indicate that the complete system or most of the system was based on Deep Learning. It resolves ambiguously if a majority of experts respond "I don't know".

(b) For the research group responsible for developing the first AGI being part of a for-profit corporation:
This question will resolve positively if the AI system that resolves the question 'Date first AGI is publicly known' was developed by a research group from a for-profit corporation. If the AI system is developed under a collaborative effort between two or more different institutions, the question resolves positively for both. For example, if OpenAI and UC Berkeley's CHAI had joined forces for the responsible project, this would count for both for-profit corporation and university.

The question resolves YES if either (a) or (b) resolves positively. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will the Eurozone collapse before 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as "yes" if, at any time between December 1, 2020 to January 1, 2030, the European Central Bank (ECB) formally closes, or the Euro is no longer the de facto primary currency for all three of Germany, France, and Italy. For the purposes of this question, being a "de facto primary currency" means that at least 50% of all transactions are conducted using that currency.
Fine Print
Edit: on April 17, 2022, clarified that "no longer the de facto primary currency" means for all three of Germany, France, and Italy, not just any one of those three.

Q_and_not_P.title:
